meanings.definition: a sequence of drawings or images displayed in a series for the purpose of visualizing a story or script
meanings.sent1: The artist created a detailed storyboard to plan out the scenes of the movie.
meanings.sent2: The director used a storyboard to map out how each shot would look in the film.
meanings.sent3: The storyboard for the animation had the characters jumping off the page!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a storyboard, each memory a vivid picture waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The storyboard of the comic book made the story come alive with each panel.

meanings.definition: to plan or outline a story or script using a series of drawings or images
meanings.sent1: She likes to storyboard her ideas before writing the actual script.
meanings.sent2: They decided to storyboard the commercial to visualize how it would look on screen.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he would storyboard his weekend plans to make them seem more exciting.
meanings.sent4: The artist storyboarded his dreams, turning them into visual narratives.
meanings.sent5: Storyboarding the plot helped the writer see the story unfold visually before writing it down.
